Reviews.Title: “Lovely budget hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: TheGetOutGirl
Reviews.Content: Crashed here for one night so we could see Playa del Carmen before heading to our all-inclusive. We read the reviews about the noise, but brought earplugs and slept through much of the racket. Fan and a/c helped keep it down too. Bed was a little hard and springy, but the place in general was adorable, a lovely (although chilly) pool and it was fun to watch the turtles and fish in the cenote. The night desk clerk, Lisette, was fantastically sweet and helpful and the location was great. (The daytime girl was not as friendly.) Also it took quite a long time for our rooms to be ready--we got there around 2 pm but couldn't check in until 5:30--and even then, the sheets from the previous occupant were on the floor, all balled up & waiting for the laundry (we just put them outside the door, and they were gone when we stepped out an hour later). There's no food but there's a great little seafood place down the street and it's around the corner from all the shops and restaurants on Calle 10. Plus it's a block from the beach and next to a fun bar called Dirty Martini. And the cost was less than a quarter of what we would have paid at our all-inclusive. Definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “So loud I checked out after 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Sam2900
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for the holidays and had to leave after the first night after the music shook our windows until 5am. Worst night I have ever spent in a hotel, did not sleep one minute. Still fighting with Expedia to get the $473 back I was charged even though I was told by hotel we would not be charged for room. Nice location and staff, just would never stay there during holidays unless you are only planning on sleeping during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: RobyH
Reviews.Content: First I have to give it up to the staff, all of the staff at Tropical Casablanca are super friendly and knowledgeable, everyday they gave us undivided attention, tips and great recommendations for food and shops. I especially want to thank Emilia and Daniella every day they gave us excellent advice in English and Spanish. The staff there goes above and beyond in providing the best information. Also the natural Cenote (Estuary) that the hotel is built around is beautiful and filled with wildlife. It is in a perfect part of town, for night life, touristy down-town, the beach, I found it closer to the beach than the resorts we had travelled to. They organized and guided us to excursions at a great rate. I have nothing but praise for the hotel. It also includes a bar and Diving Center where you can become certified in the hotel pool and go out for dives in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful stay even with the noise.”
Reviews.Author: WhereToNextt
Reviews.Content: The staff is absolutely amazing! And the owner Nicola is so wonderful. You can't help but fall in love with them, they're all just great! And the location couldn't be better...one block from the beach and one block from 5th Avenue (which if you've never been is exactly where you want to be...tons of restaurants and shopping to be done)! The unfortunate thing about this hotel though is that over the past couple of years, a few dance clubs opened up right next to the place. From what I hear, the local government can regulate the noise level during non-peak/holiday times. I was there for New Year's Eve so they couldn't really do anything about it. So if you're a light sleeper, you might want to consider another place. But if you plan on having a couple drinks before you hit the sack and have some earplugs, you will be fine. And like I said, I'd recommend the place even with the noise. Thanks again Nicola to you and your staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Loudest place you can ever imagine sleeping”
Reviews.Author: wrldtravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This is the loudest place I have ever stayed. I live in New York City and I can sleep almost anywhere. This is like sleeping in the bathroom of the loudest club you can imagine. I am in my early 30s and was there with a group of friends. We were out late every night and this was still an unbearable level of noise. Do not stay there if you plan to go to sleep before 7am. Also it was overpriced for the quality. The only positive is it was quite clean.

Reviews.Title: “quaint and romantic, great feel of local culture and diving”
Reviews.Author: faithhopeandlove
Reviews.Content: Hotel sits in hot spot area, 5th street all shopping and dining 1 blk away, diving with the Abyss Dive Shop at Tropical Casablanca amazing, staff very accomodating and service with a smile. Not a luxury hotel but great for those interested in experiencing local culture very quaint and romantic. Loud club nearby but eye masks, ear plugs and a couple of beers or glasses of wine you'll sleep just fine...dove with bull sharks & the cenotes~awesome experience~ would return again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “great personal attention”
Reviews.Author: portis71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the TCB in Feb 2010 for a total of nearly 2 weeks..From the moment I arrived I was treated as one of the family. Nicola (one of the owners) was there to personally great me on arrival and offer any assitance I required. Over the coming days all the staff became a welcome sight and were keen to ensure I was enjoying myself. They will advise you which tours would be good for your style and will do all the running around for you. The grounds and rooms are kept extremely clean and the coffee each morning in the lounge area was a great start to the day. TCB is one street over from the beach and one street over from 5th avenida, the main tourist stretch in town. There is a small bar (the dirty martini) right next to reception. Perfect for an after dive drink or quite a few after dinner. The atmosphere is friendly and the staff attentive. The Abyss dive shop is also just next door. Having returned to diving after a long spell, it was great to wake up, wander down with a coffee and then head out for the mulitple dive sites. The Abyss team were fantastic, Dave, Nick, Cori, Diana, Robert, Jason and all the boat crew made me feel welcome from the start and nothing was too much trouble. One drawback to the great location of this hotel are the local nite clubs. They are just around the corner and being a light sleeper I did suffer from the late night music. This is no fault of the hotel and Nicola is very involved in working through these challenges with the club owners and the local government. They kindly moved me on the third nite to a larger, quieter room in the back of the hotel which was alot better and after a few more nights the noise was less of an issue. Also be aware that the beds (all hotels are the same) are very firm and if you like it soft like me, you may need to bring a mattress topper or something similar. If you have any concerns though, make them known to the staff. I only had to mention the noise and they set the wheels in motion to try to solve the problem.They will work hard to make your stay a pleasant one and if you do not tell them, then they will not know. I would like to thank Nicola, Dago, Fernado, Guille, Cata and all the other staff who made my stay a memorable one. I would have no hestitation in returning to the hotel should I travel to Playa again.

Reviews.Title: “felt at home from moment i arrived”
Reviews.Author: willizannah
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay at the tcb. others have mentioned all the positives, but the helpful attitude of the entire staff must be emphasized. chatty if you want chatty. informative if you want information. immediately responsive and attentive if you need attention. never overdone or pushy. rather, just right. re. the late night noise: yes, it was noticeable, but the a/c, earplugs and "a little blue (over the counter, i.e., legal) pill" always did the trick. one other comment--there are hundreds of eating establishments in playa. nicola was very helpful in guiding us to the places that would work best for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mollystravels
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding in Playa del Carmen in early November 2009 and we chose for our family and friends to stay at Tropical Casablanca Hotel. We took over the hotel, reserving all the rooms in addition to the 6 bedroom villa (which is a beautifully decorated, modern home in the middle of the hotel). We were a very diverse group to say the least. All different ages, interestes, coming from cities all over the U.S. and England. Nicola and her staff at TCB took care of every last detail: booking activities for almost 100 people that included scuba diving, snorkelling, dinner outings, yoga, and spa services. Stocking our Villa refrigerator with beverages and constantly providing homemade food throughout the day (think huevos, guacamole, ceviche, quesadillas, pasta!). Each guest even had a customized welcome packet with their name on it, including all the scheduled activities and events, a welcome letter, a map of Playa and even a book of what the city of offers. There are many hotels to choose from in Playa but this was by far the most welcoming, hospitable, genuine staff I have seen... and I travel a lot and stay in hotels all over the world! As the bride I was able to completely relax, assured that all of my guests' needs were taken care of and that their happiness was TCB's number one priority. I could not have asked for a better week and so much is owed to Nicola and TCB for their unparalleled hospitality. I would most definitely recommend you experience TCB. And if you have an event that you're planning, they're a great team to help to you pull it off!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like going home”
Reviews.Author: chefdiver
Reviews.Content: I am presently planning my spring vacation, and this will be my forth stay with the fantastic people at TCB. Last fall I made a trip to Belize, via Playa del Carmen and this year I'm heading to Tikal in Guatamaula. So why stop at Tropical Casablanca? First of all I know whatever happens on the rest of my trip it will start and end on a high note. Whether you are new to TCB or a return visiter you are treated like an old friend. On my last trip I had three primary objectives, get to the Belize, where I already had reservations, seek out and find the best of Mexican wines and spend a few days diving with the Abyss dive shop. (part of the hotel) Nicola and her crew took care of the first two, setting me up with the bus service to the border and researching what was available in town as far as Mexican wines. (a little known secret but there are some very good ones.) As far as the diving is concerned, Dave and his staff are the best dive shop in town. Small groups and friendly caring staff guarantee a safe and enjoyable trip, whether in the ocean or the cenotes. TCB is a great place to unwind and slow down to Mexican time. It's like a little oasis in the middle of Playa del Carmen, one block from the beach, close to 5 th but still far enough removed that you are not in the center of the all night craziness that exists in some areas. I know that Dave and Nicola both spend time training their staff, but more importantly they seem to be able to attract and keep people who think like they do. As a result they have built a business that from the owners to the night watchman really care about their customers. There are many places to stay in Playa del Carmen, but if you want a small, clean, cheerful place where you are treated like family and not just another number, try the Tropical CasaBlanca.

Reviews.Title: “The feel good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lulu123Victoria
Reviews.Content: I stayed at TCB because my friends stayed there previously and had already booked their room for this trip. I trusted their opinion and went ahead and booked a room for myself. My week at the TCB was wonderful! The staff and owner went out of their way to make me feel at home and were incredibly attentive to my every needs, even ones I didn't know I had. The location is incredible and the hotel is tastefully decorated, very minimalist and easy on the eyes. The property is also very clean, the rooms are spacious and kept incredibly clean. The little bar next to the reception, The Dirty Martini, is also very nice and it was great to have a drink there before going out for dinner. Great drinks and friendly staff. Unfortunately, the weather wasn't very nice during the week we were there but thankfully we were diving so it didn't matter too much. Which leads me to The Abyss, the dive shop, that is part of the TCB property. The combination of the hotel and the dive shop meant I could wake up at a leisurely time, have a coffee and step into the shop to get suited up while still holding on to my TCB cup of coffee! The dive shop staff was wonderful as well, but I'll provide them with a glowing review on their own. I'll definetely be back and would recommend TCB to anyone looking for a nice hotel in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but noise issues”
Reviews.Author: meliha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Dec 2008. The rooms and facility are nice. Our room had a fridge but no tv. We stayed in four hotels during our trip to PDC/Tulum, and this is the only hotel that provided complimentary shampoo/conditioner. However, we did notice a little bit of smell coming from the restroom (toilet). At night, the staff light candles and place them outside. The staff is extra friendly. They went the extra mile--held our suitcases for us after checking out so that we could go on a day trip and even prevented the police from giving our car a ticket (wish there was a free parking lot nearby!). The cenote under the reception desk is awesome, and the staff made a point of taking us down to show it to us. When we visited, there were baby turtles that they were planning to set free soon. This hotel is located just around the corner from the club/party hot zone. The partying starts at 11pm and the constant thumping noise does not end until sometime between 5 and 6am. (Don't even partiers have to sleep at some point?) The window in our room was also broken so the noise penetrated into the room. We spoke with hotel staff about the noise before departing. They agreed that the noise is a problem and said they're trying to improve the situation. We don't recommend this hotel for families or for people who like to sleep at night and do activities during the day (versus people who stay up all night partying and then sleep all day). In contrast, we also stayed at Hotel Mimi Del Mar (on the beach) and Hotel Copacabana (on Quinto/5th) and neither had noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Second Home”
Reviews.Author: Parisitaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this year and loved it. From the cenote below the main building, the beautiful entrance and the proximity to the beach and 5th avenue. The staff was amazing and along with the owner were great to talk with. All came armed with great suggestions and really made you feel comfortable at all times. Loved my room and while at first I missed the TV, after about two days, I realized I was there to sit on the beach, not in my room. And in many ways it was nice to get away from the talking box. My one note while staying here (about 10 days) is that only one night was there a club nearby where the noise bothered me...but I had no problems any other nights.t.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: scuba_lady22
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time I had at your "home" - that's what it felt like. I have raved about how well we were taken care of to all my friends and they are all jealous. I know you sometimes get e-mail from those who have a few minor problems, but I wanted you and your staff to know that I enjoyed every minute I spent with you. My needs were attended to almost before I knew I needed anything - seven days of heaven. I read the earlier reviews before I left and brought a pair of soft earplugs - problem solved and I am a light sleeper!! If you are a scuba diver, there is no better place to stay than at this hotel. If only one partner dives, there is plenty to keep the non-diver busy because it is close to the center of the Playa with many beautiful shops.

Reviews.Title: “Sister in Law get away”
Reviews.Author: lazybeacher
Reviews.Content: My sister in law and i just returned from a girls getaway in Playa and Tulum. We spent 4 wonderful nights at Hotel Tropical Casa Blanca.Our first night was the Mexican Independence Day Celebration and the hotel could have been noisy, but we found none of the noise to be disturbing to our sleep. The staff is most charming. I really like the small pool at Tropcal CB. It is just big enough to get wet and cool off. The beach is a short stroll across the street. This hotel is the best location for shopping 5th ave. All the great eating spots are close by and easy to walk to. Java Joe's is just around the corner for your early coffee and roll. We had a rent car and on the celebration night I had to find a safer place to park than on the street in front of the hotel, I could not believe it when I found a parking garage in Playa! Overnight parking was only $11 USD. The rest of the time I parked on the street with no problems. Our room was charming with 2 double beds that were VERY soft and made up with lovely linens and a throw blanket. The bath was very clean and offered ample towels, face cloths, and a bath robe. They also provided small soap bottles of shampoo and conditioners. Each day the maid left us a towel design that was charming and always with a flower nearby. Our maid was actually a man, he has worked at Tropical CB for years. We took a tour of the house that Tropical has for special weekly parties. Our last trip here, the house had not been remodeled, so we were excited to get to see what Nicola had created. We were not disapointed. The house is the perfect place for a large group of guests. The kitchen was fabulous. What a party someone could have there. It has 6 lovely bedrooms. 6 private baths. Amazing place. All with Airconditioning. This hotel is small and personable. You feel like you have visited a dear friend when you leave. The conversation around the front lobby is always stimulating and on a level deeper than you would ever imagine. You can come here and get relaxed and enjoy the shopping and the beach, plus eat great seafood. Do not pass up this little slice of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: FirefoxHouston
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Tropical Casablanca several times and will continue to stay there. The staff is very helpful and friendly, offering extra amenities not normally given such as coffee and snacks in the morning and a nice glass of wine in the evening. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location is superb, as it is right in the middle of everything and the best Playa del Carmen has to offer is comfortably in walking distance. It is perfect for singles or couples to stay, and by the time you leave, you are already planning your next visit. Do yourself a favor while in Playa and stay at the Tropical Casablanca !

Reviews.Title: “feeling the culture”
Reviews.Author: sunnydaze13
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the open air reception and saw the fresh baked goods and inviting couches we were hooked. We were greeted by very friendly staff who were very helpful and bent over backwards to make my kids feel right at home including a personal tour of the cenote and the turtles right under the hotel. A huge highlight for the kids who had a great time tracking down the turtles. The location of the hotel is nicely centrally located. A few steps away from shopping on 5th avenue, and steps away from the beach at Playa which is one of the better in the area. Having the dive shop next to and part of the hotel was a huge bonus as it saved us any legwork looking for someplace to take us snorkeling. The new martini bar is a nice touch especially enjoyed by my wife. What I liked about the hotel especially is you actually feel as if your in Mexico as opposed to some of the bigger resorts that can tend to isolate you from the culture if you never leave the grounds. Sitting around the poolside and the reception area was extremely relaxing and we have great memories of just watching the world go by while we put our feet up. Rooms were comfortable and for the price was a great deal. The house that has room for multiple families is well appointed and all being well we hope to use for our Christmas holiday this year. The staff were also extremely helpful in recommending travel excursions of things to see and do which helps to relieve a lot of anxiety when your unsure of what you should spend your budget and time on. We didn't find any problem with noise as one of the previous reviewers wrote and we all slept very well without disturbances. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The feel good hotel (but not after 10pm)”
Reviews.Author: alexxxita
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights in 2 different rooms at TCB. The hotel slogan is “The feel good hotel”. A place to relax and get away from chaos. I am afraid that the hotel mission statement cannot be accomplished as it is located literally next door to Playa Del Carmen clubbing epicentre. We are talking many huge open air bars and clubs. The main intersection of where everybody goes to drink, dance and party till 4-5 in the morning. I would strongly advise NOT to stay in room 15, 14 and 13 since they are overlooking the streets of that intersection. They also have a Martini club right underneath them (it was under construction when I was there). At night, in room 15, you can almost feel the base pounding in your chest at time. So my two first night did not made me “feel good” but made me want to kill those DJ’s! I got moved to room 12 after mentioning the loud noises and the problem was solved. I could still hear a bit of music but nothing like the other room and I could easily fall asleep at anytime. The hotel front desk entrance with its big coffee table and 3 sofas under a big palapa roof is very welcoming and beautiful. The staff wear smiles and are very friendly. The hotel is all white and is surrounding a very luscious exotic garden. A nice little paradise that is very peaceful (before the clubs open). The rooms are also all white and very clean. I had one double bed, a small wood table with 2 chairs and a small fridge that was very convenient for water and fruits. The bed smelled nice and was comfortable. I enjoyed the nice chenille throw that was on top of it and the bathrobe too. The bathroom was clean and pleasant. I would recommend bringing your own shampoo and conditioner as those offered have essential oil in them that leave a greasy residue on the hair. I was disappointed that there was no TV, no telephone, no hairdryer and no safe in the rooms. I went to Wall Mart and got a hairdryer for 15$ but really was not happy about the extra spending since I already have one at home and it’s so cheap that most hotel offer one it the room knowing people don’t want to pack their luggage with these kinds of essential items. The hotel owner was very helpful and went out of her way to lend me her DVD player and she and one of the front desk employee lend me DVD. I really appreciated it. I traveled alone so I needed some entertainment at certain time of day like when returning from my afternoon at the beach or when I return after a late dinner in the evening. Coffee is offered at the front desk each morning and on Saturdays they arrange a very good buffet with chicken, fish, salad and pasta next to the pool for only 10$. I wish they would have done this every night because it was very pleasant. This is not a beach front property but it is only a few step away from it. It has a big pool where scuba diving lessons are giving in the morning by the diving company that is associated with the hotel and located right next to it. If I go back to Playa I would stay at this hotel only if I had a friend with me and as my second choice after Mimi Del Mar that offered for the same price (100$/night) beach front, beach chairs/bar/restaurant, TV, phone, safe, kitchenette and hairdryer.

HotelInfo.Name: Tropical Casablanca
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Primera Entre Calle 10 Y 12 | 1st Avenue between 10th and 12th street, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
